intro: Psoralea bituminosa var. laxa, commonly known as the looseleaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical legume structure. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are pinnately compound with slender, linear leaflets. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The species is noted for its adaptability to harsh conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
